cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 125 mi (200 km) NW of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to accelerate toward the north-northeast, cross Florida’s Big Bend Monday afternoon, then move just offshore the Georgia–South Carolina–North Carolina coasts and continue northeastward off the Mid-Atlantic coast toward the northwest Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key to Apalachee Bay area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: No tropical cyclone watches presently issued north of Florida; interests from NE Florida through South Carolina are only advised to monitor.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning in effect only from Indian Pass FL to Englewood FL (Gulf Coast).
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coastline from Florida Big Bend through Georgia, the Carolinas, and into Virginia and the Delmarva Peninsula.
weather_observation.wind: Gusty E–SE winds 25–35 kt (30–40 mph) possible Tuesday evening into early Wednesday as the center passes offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected along Virginia’s coast with current track; minor tidal departures of 1 ft or less possible.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible Tuesday–Wednesday, mainly in squalls as the system brushes the coast.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough seas for vessels entering or departing Chesapeake Bay; isolated tornado risk remains south of the port (NC).
